#!/bin/bash
# CM-3: Configuration Change Control Implementation (RHEL-08-010360)
set -euo pipefail

echo "[$(date)] Starting CM-3 Configuration Change Control Implementation"

# Create change control directory structure
sudo mkdir -p /etc/change-control/{active,approved,rejected,tested,archive}

# Create change request template
cat > /tmp/change_request.template << 'TEMPLATE'
CHANGE REQUEST TEMPLATE
======================
Request ID: [AUTO-GENERATED]
Date Submitted: [DATE]
Submitter: [NAME]
Priority: [CRITICAL/HIGH/MEDIUM/LOW]

DESCRIPTION:
- Detailed change description
- Business justification
- Expected outcomes

IMPACT ANALYSIS:
- Systems affected
- Security impact assessment
- Availability risk assessment
- Rollback complexity rating

TESTING PLAN:
- Test environment description
- Test cases and procedures
- Success criteria
- Planned test date

APPROVAL CHAIN:
- Technical review: [REVIEWER NAME]
- Security review: [SECURITY OFFICER]
- CAB approval: [CAB CHAIR]
- Approval date: [DATE]

IMPLEMENTATION:
- Implementation date/window
- Rollback procedure steps
- Communication plan
- Monitoring strategy

POST-IMPLEMENTATION:
- Verification date
- Compliance check method
- Baseline update status
- Lessons learned documentation
TEMPLATE

sudo mv /tmp/change_request.template /etc/change-control/
sudo chmod 640 /etc/change-control/change_request.template

# Create change control log file
sudo touch /etc/change-control/change_control.log
sudo chmod 640 /etc/change-control/change_control.log

# Initialize git repository for configuration version control
sudo mkdir -p /var/config-repo
cd /var/config-repo
sudo git init 2>/dev/null || true
sudo git config user.email 'admin@company.com' || true
sudo git config user.name 'ConfigManagement' || true

# Create initial commit
cat > /tmp/README.md << 'README'
# Configuration Change Control Repository

This repository maintains all approved configuration changes and baselines.

## Structure
- active/: Current change requests under review
- approved/: Approved changes awaiting implementation
- rejected/: Rejected change requests
- tested/: Changes that passed testing
- archive/: Historical changes

## Compliance
STIG-ID: RHEL-08-010360
README

sudo mv /tmp/README.md /var/config-repo/
sudo git add README.md 2>/dev/null || true
sudo git commit -m "Initial: Configuration Change Control Repository" 2>/dev/null || true

# Install version control and audit tools
sudo yum install -y git audit audit-libs 2>/dev/null || true

# Configure audit rules for change monitoring
if [ -f /etc/audit/rules.d/change-control.rules ]; then
    sudo rm /etc/audit/rules.d/change-control.rules
fi

cat > /tmp/change_control.rules << 'AUDIT'
-w /etc/change-control/ -p wa -k change_control_modifications
-w /var/config-repo/ -p wa -k configuration_repo_changes
-a always,exit -F arch=b64 -S adjtimex,settimeofday -k time-change
AUDIT

sudo mv /tmp/change_control.rules /etc/audit/rules.d/
sudo chmod 640 /etc/audit/rules.d/change-control.rules

# Reload audit rules
sudo augenrules --load 2>/dev/null || sudo service auditd restart 2>/dev/null || true

echo "[$(date)] CM-3 Configuration Change Control Implementation Complete"
echo "Change Control Framework: /etc/change-control/"
echo "Configuration Repository: /var/config-repo/"
echo "STIG Compliance: RHEL-08-010360"

# CM-7: Least Functionality - Linux Implementation
# Disable non-essential services and ports to minimize attack surface

    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "$LOG_FILE"

)

#!/bin/bash
# CM-8: System Component Inventory
# Maintain comprehensive hardware and software inventory

set -euo pipefail

INVENTORY_FILE="/var/lib/cm8_system_inventory.json"

log_message() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "/var/log/cm8_inventory.log"
}

log_message "[*] Generating system inventory"

# Collect hardware information
HOSTNAME=$(hostname)
OS_VERSION=$(lsb_release -ds 2>/dev/null || uname -s)
KERNEL=$(uname -r)
CPU_CORES=$(nproc)
TOTAL_MEMORY=$(free -h | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}')
DISK_USAGE=$(df -h / | awk 'NR==2 {print $2}')

# Count installed packages
if command -v rpm &> /dev/null; then
    PKG_COUNT=$(rpm -qa | wc -l)
    PKG_MANAGER="rpm"
else
    PKG_COUNT=$(dpkg -l | wc -l)
    PKG_MANAGER="dpkg"
fi

# Create inventory record
{
    echo "Inventory Timestamp: $(date -I)"
    echo "Hostname: $HOSTNAME"
    echo "OS: $OS_VERSION"
    echo "Kernel: $KERNEL"
    echo "CPU Cores: $CPU_CORES"
    echo "Memory: $TOTAL_MEMORY"
    echo "Root Disk: $DISK_USAGE"
    echo "Packages: $PKG_COUNT ($PKG_MANAGER)"
    echo "Service Count: $(systemctl list-units --type=service | wc -l)"
} | tee "$INVENTORY_FILE"

log_message "[+] Inventory saved to $INVENTORY_FILE"

)

function Write-Log {
    param([string]$Message)
    Write-Host "[$(Get-Date -Format 'yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss')] $Message"
}

Write-Log "Generating system inventory"

# Gather hardware information
$computerInfo = Get-ComputerInfo

$processor = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Processor
$memory = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_ComputerSystemProduct

# Gather software inventory
$software = Get-WmiObject -Class Win32_Product | Select-Object Name, Version, Vendor, InstallDate

# Create inventory object
$inventory = @{
    CaptureDate = Get-Date -Format "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ"
    ComputerName = $env:COMPUTERNAME
    OSVersion = $os.Caption
    OSBuild = $os.BuildNumber
    ProcessorCores = $processor.NumberOfCores
    ProcessorThreads = $processor.NumberOfLogicalProcessors
    TotalMemory = "{0:N0} GB" -f ($computerInfo.CsTotalPhysicalMemory / 1GB)
    InstalledSoftwareCount = $software.Count
    InstalledServices = @(Get-Service | Where-Object {$_.Status -eq 'Running'} | Measure-Object).Count
    NetworkInterfaces = @(Get-NetAdapter | Measure-Object).Count
}

# Export inventory
$inventory | ConvertTo-Json | Out-File -FilePath $InventoryPath -Force
Write-Log "Inventory saved to $InventoryPath"
Write-Host ($inventory | ConvertTo-Json)

# CM-8.1: Component Acquisition Tracking
# Detect new hardware/software added to system

set -euo pipefail

BASELINE_FILE="/etc/cm81_hw_baseline.txt"
CURRENT_FILE="/tmp/cm81_hw_current.txt"

log_message() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "/var/log/cm81_tracking.log"
}

log_message "[*] Checking for new hardware..."

# Capture hardware inventory
{
    echo "=== Hardware Devices ==="
    lsblk -o NAME,SIZE,TYPE
    echo "=== Network Interfaces ==="
    ip link show
    echo "=== USB Devices ==="
    lsusb 2>/dev/null || echo "lsusb not available"
} > "$CURRENT_FILE"

if [ -f "$BASELINE_FILE" ]; then
    if ! diff -q "$BASELINE_FILE" "$CURRENT_FILE" > /dev/null; then
        log_message "[!] ALERT: Hardware configuration changed"
        log_message "Changes detected:"
        diff "$BASELINE_FILE" "$CURRENT_FILE" | head -20
    fi
else
    log_message "[*] Creating hardware baseline"
    cp "$CURRENT_FILE" "$BASELINE_FILE"
fi

log_message "[+] Hardware tracking complete"

#!/bin/bash
# CM-9: Configuration Management Baseline
# Establish and maintain system configuration baseline

set -euo pipefail

BASELINE_DIR="/etc/cm9_baselines"
mkdir -p "$BASELINE_DIR"

log_message() {
    echo "[$(date '+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')] $1" | tee -a "/var/log/cm9_baseline.log"
}

log_message "[*] Creating configuration baseline"

# Capture system state
{
    echo "=== System Configuration Baseline ==="
    echo "Capture Date: $(date -I)"
    echo "Hostname: $(hostname)"
    echo "OS: $(lsb_release -ds 2>/dev/null || uname -s)"
    echo ""
    echo "=== Kernel Configuration ==="
    uname -a
    echo ""
    echo "=== Enabled Services ==="
    systemctl list-units --type=service --state=enabled --no-pager
    echo ""
    echo "=== System Limits ==="
    ulimit -a
} > "$BASELINE_DIR/system_baseline_$(date +%Y%m%d).txt"

# Create checksum file for integrity verification
find "$BASELINE_DIR" -name "*.txt" -type f | xargs sha256sum > "$BASELINE_DIR/baseline_checksums.txt"

log_message "[+] Baseline documentation complete"
